commit.message:
Address feedback

Given that all similar methods in Utils check for an exact ElementKind, it might be better to rename just the isClass method.

Match methods instead of executable elements

Constructors are not inherited and initializers cannot be documented; this leaves us with methods.

Refactor Utils.isAnnotationType

  * Renames the method to match the JLS terminology (there is more source code to be aligned with JLS later)
  * Fixes confusing implementation that accepted elements enclosed by an annotations interface; adjusts some of the call sites
  * Inlines poorly named variable isAnnotatedTypeElement

Use methods from ElementKind

Note that while ElementKind methods are less specific, they are more correct to use:

  * ElementKind.isExecutable() includes STATIC_INIT
  * ElementKind.isVariable() includes BINDING_VARIABLE

Utils.isClass's doc comment was outdated as it didn't include RECORD; I changed that doc comment to something more useful.
